text: Let's dig into some of the info we have in this information panel.

In PonziLand, when you buy a land, you need to choose a token to use.

It will both be the token you use to pay taxes, and the one other players will give you to buy your land.
Interesting, isn't it?
All lands have a sell price set by their owner, that any player can pay to own the land.
The taxes paid per hour are calculated based on a percentage of the sell price set by the owner.
You pay those taxes from the stake put into a land.
In the same way that you pay taxes to your neighbors, you can also receive income from them.
The net earnings should be self explanatory. You combine all of what you get from neighbor per hour at the current token prices, substract what you pay them. It updates frequently.
The nuke time here is based on the sell price and remaining stake. If it ever goes too low, you can add more stake to keep your land for a bit longer.

Now, let's buy a land.

Let's get started by opening the buy menu.

I'm good at building, but not good at setting prices.

Can you try making it profitable?
continue: Click on the buy now button when the land is profitable if both or left to collect taxes.

text: Wouh. That's a cool castle.
There is another way to get a land, construction sites.

When they appear, the price starts really high.
Over time, the price goes down. At the start, it decreases quickly, then slows down as the price approaches zero.
Other players might also want that construction site, so buy it before the prices becomes too interesting

Time is going fast! Seems like your land doesn't have a lot of stake anymore, and will be nuked soon.
Let's prevent that!
Open the information panel for your land, using the "Info" button

In the information panel, you can increase the stake using the "Increase Stake" form.

Do it, I would prefer not have a building explode again.
If the lands around you increased a lot in price, you can also increase the price of your land on this screen.
If you want to sell your land, you can do it here
I think you now have all the basics to get started. Enjoy your time in PoniLand!
